name: PanoPuzzle
description:
Panorama puzzle

Drag   to move the  view.
Click/touch the puzzle pieces to rotate them until the puzzle is solved.
Zoom out (top left) lets you look at/solve the puzzle from the outside of a cube.
Any pop-up box can be closed by clicking on it/touching it.

There are  22 levels with a mix of real world and generated panoramas. 
Once a level is finished  you  need to press Next (top right)  to go to the next level.
All settings can be changed independently and will be saved for coming levels.
After finishing a level you can change difficulty and replay the level - then Next stays active to move to the next level at any time.

PanoPuzzle now has
- distortion free zooming from the inside (zoom with mouse wheel)
- tile counter can be switched on/off
- rotation clock or anti clockwise
- drag direction normal or inverted
- configurable hint system which will highlight a wrong tile
- 3 basic levels 
  easy   - only 10% of tiles are rotated and hints are on
  hard   - 90% of tiles are rotated hints are off
  normal - as per config file - no hints
  Changing difficulty will reshuffle the tiles
